title: Synchrony Names Brian Doubles as CEO
sub_head: Mr. Doubles to remain president; current chief Margaret Keane to become executive chairman
body:
Synchrony Financial said Tuesday that its president, Brian Doubles, will become chief executive on April 1.
The current CEO, Margaret Keane, will become executive chairman.
Mr. Doubles, 45 years old, has worked at Synchrony, the largest U.S. store credit-card issuer, for 11 years and will remain president. He became president of the Stamford, Conn.-based company in 2019. He previously was chief financial officer.
Ms. Keane, 61, is one of the few female CEOs in banking. She helped take the company public in 2014, after its separation from General Electric Co. Before the IPO, Ms. Keane and Mr. Doubles worked as CEO and CFO, respectively, of GE’s retail card division, which was spun off to create Synchrony.
The company, which issues store-branded credit cards for Sam’s Club, Gap Inc. and other large merchants, has been trying to diversify beyond bricks-and-mortar merchants as consumers shift more of their shopping online. In recent years, Synchrony has expanded its partnership with PayPal Holdings Inc.
